bookTitle: St. Francis of Assisi: Passion, Poverty and the Man who Transformed the Catholic Church

questions.question: Where in the Holy Land did Francis arrive in July of 1219?
questions.correctAnswer: St. John of Acre the capital city of the Latin Kingdom of the Holy Land
distractors: Jerusalem, the holy city
Bethlehem, the birthplace of Christ
Nazareth, where Jesus grew up
Jaffa, the port city
Caesarea, on the coast

questions.question: What did Brother Elias and the other friars explain to Francis when he arrived in Acre?
questions.correctAnswer: Because of the fifth crusade (war), he could not visit Bethlehem, Nazareth or Jerusalem
distractors: The leper hospitals needed his help immediately
The Sultan had requested to meet with him
The Christian army was preparing for a major battle
The Pope had sent new instructions for the friars
There was a plague affecting the local population

questions.question: What was Francis' wild idea to bring peace to Muslims and Christians?
questions.correctAnswer: He would travel to the Muslim community, meet with the sultan and preach the peace of Christ
distractors: He would organize a peaceful march between the armies
He would fast until both sides agreed to negotiate
He would rebuild churches destroyed in the fighting
He would establish a neutral monastery between the camps
He would petition the Pope to call off the crusade

questions.question: What was the situation between the Christians and Muslims when Francis arrived in Damietta?
questions.correctAnswer: The Christian crusaders were outnumbered and had lost access to Jerusalem
distractors: The Christians had just won a decisive victory
A peace treaty was being negotiated
The Muslims were retreating from the region
Both sides were preparing for a final battle
A plague had stopped all fighting

questions.question: What was the cardinal's reaction when Francis asked for permission to cross the military lines?
questions.correctAnswer: He said that they were uncivilized savages and would crucify him
distractors: He immediately gave his blessing
He asked Francis to wait for a safer time
He suggested Francis send a letter instead
He offered to go with Francis
He forbade Francis from attempting it

questions.question: What did Francis learn about himself that helped him become a man of peace at the beginning of his conversion in Spoleto?
questions.correctAnswer: By living the first commandment, he would put God first and live an upright life
distractors: That violence only leads to more suffering
That true courage is found in loving enemies
That God calls the weak to confound the strong
That prayer is more powerful than weapons
That humility defeats pride

questions.question: What did Francis learn about forgiveness from serving the poor lepers?
questions.correctAnswer: By helping someone he despised, he made a connection with humanity and learned how to forgive which was the foundation of peace
distractors: That God forgives those who forgive others
That forgiveness requires great sacrifice
That the poor are more forgiving than the rich
That suffering teaches compassion
That Christ forgave from the cross

questions.question: Why did Francis empty himself of worldly things and seek to only be filled by the blessings of the Holy Spirit?
questions.correctAnswer: He found peace in lowliness and humility instead of earthly glories
distractors: He wanted to imitate the poverty of Christ
He believed possessions led to sin
He sought spiritual power through emptiness
He was commanded by God in a vision
He wanted to prove his devotion to God

questions.question: How did Francis help in the Christian crusaders camp?
questions.correctAnswer: Tended the wounded and consoled the soldiers
distractors: Preached to the troops before battle
Blessed weapons and armor
Provided food and supplies
Led prayers and masses
Negotiated with Muslim prisoners

questions.question: Under what conditions did Cardinal Pelagius give permission to Francis to cross the military lines?
questions.correctAnswer: He was not to be seen as an arbitrator or acting on orders from the cardinal
distractors: He must return within three days
He must take armed guards with him
He must report everything to the cardinal
He must not preach Christianity to Muslims
He must carry letters from the Pope

questions.question: What did Francis and Brother Illuminato have with them when they walked across the military lines?
questions.correctAnswer: Only their tunic, the cross and the Word of God
distractors: Letters of safe passage from the cardinal
Gifts for the Sultan
Food and water for the journey
Relics from the Holy Land
A Bible and prayer book

questions.question: From Francis's perspective, what role did the gospel have in bringing about peace?
questions.correctAnswer: Only Christ could bring true peace, the gospel had to be present especially in the virtues of love, humility, fraternity and reconciliation
distractors: The gospel would convert all people to Christianity
The gospel promised victory to the righteous
The gospel commanded Christians to make peace
The gospel revealed God's plan for the Holy Land
The gospel showed the way to defeat evil

questions.question: What does fraternity have to do with Francis' model of peacemaking?
questions.correctAnswer: Francis strove to become a brother to all people, by sharing his life experiences and the gospel
distractors: All Christians must unite as brothers against unbelievers
Religious brothers should mediate between warring parties
Treating others as family prevents conflict
Brotherhood in Christ transcends all divisions
Francis formed a brotherhood dedicated to peace

questions.question: What kind of encounter did Francis and Brother Illuminato have with the Saracen soldiers?
questions.correctAnswer: They were beaten and threatened with death
distractors: They were welcomed as holy men
They were immediately taken to the Sultan
They were turned away at the border
They were imprisoned for questioning
They were escorted safely through the camp

questions.question: How did Francis and Brother Illuminato disarm and calm the soldiers?
questions.correctAnswer: They called out the name of the sultan and responded to the violence with a peaceful manner
distractors: They showed letters from the cardinal
They offered gifts and money
They spoke in Arabic to explain themselves
They performed a miracle
They prayed loudly in Latin

questions.question: What kind of ruler was Sultan Malik al-Kamil?
questions.correctAnswer: He was more open minded than previous sultans
distractors: He was a fierce warrior focused only on military conquest
He was a harsh tyrant who persecuted Christians
He was weak and easily manipulated by advisors
He was young and inexperienced in ruling
He was interested only in wealth and luxury

questions.question: What was the common language between the sultan and Francis?
questions.correctAnswer: French
distractors: Latin
Arabic
Italian
Greek
They used interpreters

acceptableAnswers: He was different from others who came with the sword
He came with humility and poverty
He came as a brother not as an enemy
distractors: He was a great scholar of theology
He had miraculous powers from God
He was sent by the Pope to negotiate
He was willing to convert to Islam
He was a holy hermit seeking solitude

questions.question: What Muslim practice did the sultan attribute to Francis refusing the wealthy gifts offered to him?
questions.correctAnswer: Zakat, one of the five required pillars of the Muslim faith which required believers to give away their income and embrace purity
distractors: Hajj, the pilgrimage to Mecca
Salat, the five daily prayers
Sawm, fasting during Ramadan
Shahada, the declaration of faith
Jihad, striving in the path of God

questions.question: What are some things you might see when Muslims gather for prayer during the day?
questions.correctAnswer: Prayer mats, everyone facing the same direction and bowing and kissing the ground, and greeting one another with peace
distractors: Candles burning and incense filling the air
Reading from holy books while standing
Singing hymns and playing instruments
Washing hands and feet in holy water
Wearing special robes and head coverings

questions.question: What elements of the Muslim religion could Francis agree with as he considered them to be included in his fraternity?
questions.correctAnswer: They were devoted to prayer and they believed in one God
distractors: Their five pillars of faith
Their holy book the Quran
Their prophet Muhammad
Their pilgrimage to Mecca
Their charitable giving practices

questions.question: What about Francis' faith impressed the sultan?
questions.correctAnswer: His inner peace, his ability to interact with Muslims in a respectable way, his refusal to give in to wealth and riches, and his way of responding to war with the peace of Christ
distractors: His knowledge of the Quran and Islamic teaching
His willingness to die as a martyr
His miracle-working powers
His eloquent arguments for Christianity
His connections to the Pope and church leaders

questions.question: Did either Francis convert to the Muslim religion or the sultan convert to Christianity? What beautiful thing happened?
questions.correctAnswer: No, neither changed their faith. The sultan responded with a gesture of peace
distractors: Yes, the sultan secretly converted to Christianity
Yes, Francis adopted some Muslim practices
No, but they agreed to study each other's religions
No, but they agreed to stop the fighting
Yes, both agreed to worship the same God together

questions.question: What did Francis receive from the sultan?
questions.correctAnswer: Administration and control of the Christian holy sites in the Muslim territory to the followers of Francis, a gift of an ivory horn and a prayer mat, also a letter for safe conduct to travel freely and securely throughout the Muslim territories
distractors: Gold and jewels to fund the Franciscan order
A palace in Jerusalem for the friars
Military protection for all Christian pilgrims
A promise to end the war immediately
Permission to preach Christianity throughout his lands

questions.question: What could Francis finally do accompanied by the sultan's soldiers?
questions.correctAnswer: Walk in the footsteps of Jesus in the Holy Land
distractors: Rebuild the destroyed churches
Baptize Muslim converts
Establish Franciscan monasteries
Preach to large crowds
Meet with Christian prisoners

questions.question: What sites in the Holy Land did Francis visit?
questions.correctAnswer: Church of the Holy Sepulchre, Calvary where Jesus died, and the tomb of Christ where Christ was buried and resurrected
distractors: The Garden of Gethsemane, the Mount of Olives, and the Jordan River
Bethlehem, Nazareth, and the Sea of Galilee
The Temple Mount, the Western Wall, and the Via Dolorosa
The Upper Room, the Garden Tomb, and Golgotha
Mount Tabor, Cana, and Capernaum
